definition: to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Where the positions specified in the preceding paragraph involve State secrets, the appointment system shall not be implemented.
sentences.chinese: 前款所列職位涉及國家祕密的，不實行聘任制。

sentences.english: The appointment of professional and technical posts of those personnel shall be affirmed by the enterprise itself.
sentences.chinese: 其專業技術職務的聘任由民辦科技企業自行確定。

sentences.english: Few papers on the college-teacher appointment in early modern China have been published.
sentences.chinese: 關於近代中國大學教師的聘任問題，鮮有專論。

sentences.english: The deputy director and accountant are appointed by the director through professional examination and assessment.
sentences.chinese: 副主任和會計人選經專業考試考覈，由主任聘任。

sentences.english: The first chapters are fundamental government functionary appointment system theory.
sentences.chinese: 第一章爲公務員聘任制的基本理論。

sentences.english: The vice chairpersons and other members of the commission shall be appointed by the Municipal Government. Each term of the membership shall be 3 years.
sentences.chinese: 副主任委員和其他委員由市政府聘任，每屆任期三年。

sentences.english: Yes, foreigners may be appointed as arbitrators of a foreign arbitration commission.
sentences.chinese: 外籍人士可以被聘任爲涉外仲裁委員會仲裁員。

sentences.english: and 4. it must have arbitrators for appointment.
There are 182,600 full-time teachers altogether, to whom professional appointment system is applied.
sentences.chinese: 全國共有182600專職教師，實行職責聘任制。

sentences.english: Third chapters are the process that west public servants appointment system builds and their experience.
sentences.chinese: 第三章爲西方國家公務員聘任制建立的過程及其經驗。

sentences.english: Contract management should be carried out to the post appointment personnel.
sentences.chinese: 對聘任人員實行契約化管理。

sentences.english: Language departments additionally employ foreign experts and nationally renowned scholars as long-term lecturers.
sentences.chinese: 各語系還長期聘任外籍專家和國內知名學者授課。

sentences.english: The appointment, dismissal, promotion and demotion of civil servants in the recruitment system shall be provided for separately.
sentences.chinese: 聘任制公務員的職務任免與職務升降，另行規定。

sentences.english: Zhu Qizhan was engaged and became a council member and professor of Shanghai Xinhua Art School.
sentences.chinese: 受聘任上海新華藝術專科學校教授與校董。

sentences.english: Fifth chapters are to perfect several our country government functionary appointment system thinking.
sentences.chinese: 第五章爲完善我國政府公務員聘任制的幾點思考。

sentences.english: But they weren't hiring women just then.
sentences.chinese: 但當時沒有人聘任女性。

definition: hired (for employment)/invited (e.g. to lecture)/engaged (for a task)/(in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
to hold an office or post
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
full-time/to appoint sb to a specific task
